** custom macros without arguments
.
some text \empty\ inside.
.


** custom macros with a mandatory argument
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{echo}
\begin{document}
some text \echoOGO{with a macro}
\end{document}
.


** custom macros with an optional argument
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{echo}
\begin{document}
some text \echoO[with a macro]
\end{document}
.


** custom macros with optional and mandatory arguments, mixed with space and comments
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{echo}
\begin{document}
some text, \echoGOG{mandatory arg} [%
,  % another comment
 ]
 {more mandatory} inside.
\end{document}
.


** brackets can be used in optional arguments when protected by a group
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{echo}
\begin{document}
% echo simply outputs its arguments delimited by + (mandatory args) or - (optional args)
\echoOGO[{t]}t]{ext} more
\end{document}
.


** custom macros with optional and mandatory arguments, mixed with newlines
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{echo}
\begin{document}
some text \echoOGO{again} [ % test

 ]% another comment

  {more} in a new paragraph.
\end{document}
.
